item.title: .NET AI Community Standup - üîÆ Fortune-Telling with Semantic Kernel
item.description:
What do your birth date, time, and place say about your future? In Korea, fortune tellers use complex math to create a perpetual calendar‚Äîbut now, we're giving that tradition a modern .NET twist! üíª‚ú®
Join Bruno and Justin as they summon the powers of Azure OpenAI, Semantic Kernel, and Azure Container Apps dynamic sessions to build an intelligent .NET app that calculates your birth chart and lets an LLM interpret your destiny.
From generating and executing Python code on-the-fly to orchestrating it all with Semantic Kernel, they‚Äôll show live demos, share clever tricks, and spark ideas for your own AI-powered experiences.
Community Links: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/collections/8xymaztyqqe21r
Featuring: Bruno Capuano (@elbruno), Justin Yoo (@justinchronicle)
#dotnet #AI #SemanticKernel #AzureOpenAI #AzureContainerApps
item.author: (dotnet)

item.title: Use ANY Model with GitHub Copilot & Visual Studio Code! Custom Models are Here!
item.description:
Custom models just landed in GitHub Copilot inside of VS Code! This means you can easily connect to Anthropic, OpenAI, Azure AI, Gemini, and more including running custom models inside of Ollama on your own machine! Let's get into it!
Join this channel to get access to perks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCENTmbKaTphpWV2R2evVz2A/join

item.title: Eventing in C#
item.description:
üéØ Mastering Events and Delegates in C# In this video, we dive deep into eventing in C# ‚Äî from the basics to advanced techniques used in real-world enterprise systems.
üîç What you‚Äôll learn: ‚úÖ Introduction to events and delegates in C# ‚úÖ How to implement eventing in enterprise-level applications ‚úÖ Best practices and advanced patterns for robust event-driven architecture
Whether you're new to C# or looking to sharpen your skills for enterprise development, this video will give you the practical insights and patterns you need.
üìå Chapters: 0:00 - Introduction 1:45 - What are Events and Delegates in C# 5:30 - Eventing in Enterprise Systems 22:00 - Advanced Eventing Techniques and Best Practices 25:00 - Final Thoughts and Tips
üìö Helpful Resources: Microsoft Docs - Events and Delegates https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/events/
The Standard https://github.com/hassanhabib/The-Standard
Source Code https://github.com/hassanhabib/EventingDemo
üëç Like, üí¨ comment, and üîî subscribe if you find this helpful! Let me know in the comments how you use eventing in your projects.
#CSharp #Eventing #Delegates #DotNet #EnterpriseArchitecture
item.author: (Hassan Habib)

item.title: Role Based Authorization in ASP .NET Core (using Identity and JWT)
item.description:
In this tutorial we will talk about role based authorization in ASP .NET Core Web API that uses Identity for user management and provides JWT after successful authentication.
In this tutorial I've used the API that was built in my tutorial about JWT/Refresh Token Authentication in ASP .NET Core Web API, feel free to check it out to get the proper understanding about it. In description of this video, you will find the link to the github where I've posted the source code.
JWT Authentication in ASP .NET Core with Refresh Token (.NET 9): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G6eEPPBIkh8
By the end of this video, you‚Äôll have a fully functional authorization system that ensures only authorized users can access specific resources in your API project based on Role claim in JSON web token.
Support me on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/remigiuszzalewski Follow me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/remigiusz-zalewski Follow me on Medium: https://medium.com/@remigiuszzalewski Check out my Blog: https://remigiuszzalewski.com Source code: https://github.com/RemigiuszZalewski/Role-Based-Authorization-In-ASP-.NET-Core
item.author: (Remigiusz Zalewski)
